bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Walter M. Simpson, November 17, 1941

div1.p: Hench sends Simpson a reprint of his yellow fever article in "Hygeia," and thanks Simpson for his help in its publication.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Walter M. Simpson, November 17, 1941
div1.opener:
November 17, 1941
Dr. Walter Simpson
134 Apple Street
Dayton, Ohio
Dear Walt:
div1.p:
It was very nice to see you in Chicago,
even if for only a few minutes. I am sending you
a reprint which you had much to do with. I surely
appreciated your suggestion and sent the manuscript
to Fishbein who took it at once. Now you see the
results.

We do hope June is well by now. Give her
our very best.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
